segment.target: How to Apply Performance Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Apply Performance Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply Performance Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: The following performance setting can be defined for each MED-V workspace:
segment.target: The following performance setting can be defined for each MED-V workspace:

segment.source: VM memory allocation
segment.target: VM memory allocation

segment.source: Performance settings are configured in the Policy module, on the Performance tab.
segment.target: Performance settings are configured in the Policy module, on the Performance tab.

segment.source: To apply performance settings to a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To apply performance settings to a MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.
segment.target: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.

segment.source: In the Performance pane, configure the settings as described in the following table.
segment.target: In the Performance pane, configure the settings as described in the following table.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: Performance Settings Properties
segment.target: Performance Settings Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Adjust VM memory, based on amount of the Host machine's physical memory
segment.target: Adjust VM memory, based on amount of the Host machine's physical memory

segment.source: Select this check box, and configure the following virtual machine properties in the table:
segment.target: Select this check box, and configure the following virtual machine properties in the table:

segment.source: Host Memory—Define the common host RAM configuration in your organization based on any numbers of groups to configure.
segment.target: Host Memory—Define the common host RAM configuration in your organization based on any numbers of groups to configure.

segment.source: VM Memory—Enter the amount of host memory to allocate to the virtual machine.
segment.target: VM Memory—Enter the amount of host memory to allocate to the virtual machine.
